example.eg: I can catch the ball with one hand.
example.egtrans: 我可以单手接球。

example.eg: Bill needs to catch a bus from town.
example.egtrans: 比尔需要从镇上搭乘公共汽车。

example.eg: Jason caught her by the wrist.
example.egtrans: 杰森抓住她的手腕。

example.eg: We caught five salmon in the river.
example.egtrans: 我们在河里抓到了五条鲑鱼。

example.eg: Leah catches a cold every winter.
example.egtrans: 利亚每年冬天都会感冒。

example.eg: The police caught him in the act.
example.egtrans: 警察当场抓住了他。

example.eg: As I was riding my bicycle, my shoelaces caught on the gears.
example.egtrans: 在我骑脚踏车的时候，鞋带缠在牙盘上了。

example.eg: Wendy's catch saved the vase from breaking on the floor.
example.egtrans: 温迪接住了花瓶，避免了其掉到地上摔碎的命运。

example.eg: Salmon is the catch of the day.
example.egtrans: 今天的捕获物是鲑鱼。

example.eg: What's the catch?
example.egtrans: 有什么陷阱？

example.eg: The catch on the suitcase is stuck.
example.egtrans: 手提箱闩锁卡住了。

example.eg: The goalkeeper's catch saved the game for the home team.
example.egtrans: 守门员一记接球，为主场球队挽回了比赛。

example.eg: Eddie loves to sing songs and catches from the Victorian era.
example.egtrans: 埃迪喜欢唱维多利亚时代的歌谣和轮唱曲。

dsense.name: a catch, quite a catch, a real catch

example.eg: I hear her new man is quite a catch!
example.egtrans: 我听说她新钓到了一个金龟婿。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 值得嫁娶的人, 可以婚配的人

dsense.name: catch
dsense.guideword: uncountable (game: throwing ball back and forth) (运动)

example.eg: The boys were playing a game of catch, but William kept dropping the ball.
I could tell from the catch in Steven's voice that this was an emotive issue for him.
Lou dropped a match and the gasoline caught.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 着火, 烧着, 烧着

example.eg: Jennifer is catching in the softball game today.
example.egtrans: 珍妮弗在今天的垒球比赛中当接球手。

example.eg: Lara's voice caught on her late husband's name, and she began to cry.

dsense.name: catch [sth]⇒
dsense.guideword: informal, figurative (see) (电视节目或广播等)

example.eg: Did you catch the news last night?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 看到, 听到, 获悉

example.eg: I didn't catch what you said.
example.egtrans: 我没听清楚你说的话。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 听清楚, 了解, 理解

example.eg: You might be able to catch him if you hurry.
example.egtrans: 如果赶紧，你也许还能追上他。

example.eg: Let's catch the art show at the museum before it closes.
The fly was caught in the spider's web.
The artist caught her expression beautifully.
Would you just catch my coat for a second while I make a telephone call?
Alice caught her boyfriend eating cookies in the middle of the night.
example.egtrans: 爱丽丝逮到男朋友半夜偷吃饼干。

example.eg: Jane caught at Pete's arm and pulled him back onto the sidewalk as a car zoomed past.
I told her that he'd poisoned his wife with arsenic, but she didn't catch on.
example.egtrans: 我告诉她他用砒霜毒死了妻子，不过她没有理解。

example.eg: Do you think that the practice of people sewing their own clothing will ever catch on again?
example.egtrans: 自己动手缝制衣服会不会再次流行起来，你怎么看？

example.eg: The detective suspected the suspect was lying, so she kept asking him questions in the hope of catching him out.
example.egtrans: 警探怀疑嫌疑犯在撒谎，所以她不断地发问，希望抓住他的错漏。

example.eg: Mira slowed down so that her younger sister could catch up.
example.egtrans: 米拉放慢速度，以便她妹妹能追上。

dsense.name: catch up with [sb/sth], also US: catch up to [sb/sth]

example.eg: I walk faster than he does, so I wait at each corner for him to catch up with me.
example.egtrans: 我走得比他快，所以我在每个转角都会等他赶上来。

dsense.name: catch up with [sb], also US: catch up to [sb/sth]

example.eg: You go on ahead; I'll catch up with you as soon as I've finished my work here.
example.egtrans: 你先走，我一完成这里的工作就去找你。

example.eg: Start walking and I'll catch you up; I need to fetch my coat first.
example.egtrans: 你先走，我会赶上你的。我得先去拿下外套。

example.eg: I missed a week of work, and now I have to catch up.
example.egtrans: 我耽误了一周的工作，现在得补上。

example.eg: Audrey sighed when she saw that she had to catch up on a huge pile of work.
example.egtrans: 看到自己必须赶完一大堆工作时候，奥黛丽叹了口气。

dsense.name: catch up with [sb], also US: catch up to [sb]
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (repay: with [sth] bad) (过去造成的问题带来麻烦)

example.eg: Finally, his unhealthy habits caught up with him and he became very sick.
example.egtrans: 最后，他那些不健康的坏习惯来找他麻烦了：他病得非常严重。

example.eg: The cops finally caught up with the shoplifter outside the stock exchange.
example.egtrans: 警察最终在证券交易所外抓住了那个商店扒手。

example.eg: My friends and I like to catch up over a coffee once a month.
example.egtrans: 我和朋友们喜欢每月喝一次咖啡叙叙旧。

example.eg: It was a pleasure to catch up with everyone at the family reunion.
example.egtrans: 在家庭聚会上与大家交流近况令人感到愉快。

example.eg: I phoned my brother to catch up on the latest news back home.
example.egtrans: 我给哥哥打电话，以了解家里面的最新情况。

example.eg: It's a real Catch-22: to get a job you need experience, but to get experience you need a job.
John would be hurt if she didn't invite him, but if she did, Mary wouldn't come.  It was a Catch-22.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 左右为难的情况，进退两难的境地

dsense.name: catch 22 situation, Catch 22 situation, catch-22 situation, Catch-22 situation
catch a cold, catch cold, take a cold

example.eg: If you go out in this rain without a coat you're liable to catch a cold.

dsense.name: catch a glimpse of [sth/sb], catch a brief glimpse of [sth/sb]

example.eg: I caught a glimpse of Peter as he walked past my house.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 瞥见, 很快地看…一眼

dsense.name: catch a train, catch the train

example.eg: I'm going to catch a train home after I get out from work.

dsense.name: catch fire, catch on fire, also UK: catch light, catch alight, also US: take fire

example.eg: Gasoline can catch fire very easily. If you knock that candle onto the rug, it will catch on fire.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 激起热情, 激起狂热

example.eg: He was sure to catch hell from his wife for his behaviour.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 遭严厉训斥, 被狠骂一顿

example.eg: Mr. Jones caught hold of Mark by the collar and dragged him off to see the headmaster.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抓住, 握住, 抓牢

dsense.name: catch it
dsense.guideword: informal (be punished or reprimanded) (非正式用语)

example.eg: The offer of early retirement caught me off guard; I hadn't guessed it was coming.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使…惊讶, 趁…不备，使…措手不及

example.eg: I caught the thief red handed stealing my jewels.
When I caught sight of my appearance in the mirror, I immediately rushed back to my closet to change.
example.egtrans: 当我瞥见自己镜中的模样时，我立马冲回衣柜去换衣服。

example.eg: His manly voice caught my attention.
The bold designs and bright colours of these dresses really catch the eye.
Laura's performance in the show caught the eye of talent scouts.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 引起...的注意, 吸引...的关注

example.eg: The question caught the minister unawares; she didn't have an answer prepared.
The employees caught wind of the coming lay-offs, and were very upset.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 听说, 有流言说, 喘过气来

example.eg: Now that we're done with most of the rush jobs, we can catch our breath.

dsense.name: catch your death, catch your death of cold

trans_examp.trans_cn: 无所不包之物, 用途多样之物
无所不包的, 用途多样的
用尽一切办法的，抓住一切机会的

example.eg: I haven't seen you for ages; we'll have to have a proper catch-up soon.
The cyclist's catch-up ultimately failed, and he finished third in the race.
Inflation is rising fast, so the company intends to give its employees a catch-up pay rise.
Suddenly, everyone seemed to be repeating the company's memorable catchphrase.
The comedian repeated his catchphrase at every possible opportunity.
Julia wanted to play catch-up and find out what had happened while she had been away.

dsense.name: play catch-up
dsense.guideword: informal (do work missed due to illness)

example.eg: I had to play catch-up after being away from work on sick leave.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 赶工, 补上没有做的工作
